text: anyone mind taking a look at my code and telling me how i could be doing this more efficiently? i tried doing a kind of proxy pattern at first but couldn't really figure it out, and it ended up turning out into an organized heap of duplicated code

attachments.title: damien5314/HoldTheNarwhal
attachments.text: Contribute to HoldTheNarwhal development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: this is just an OAuth proxy for the RedditServiceAPI class
everything up to line 231 is required but after that, it's just basically one of two code blocks for every API call
also sorry if this wasn't the original intent of this channel but seeing as how we don't have a project really active yet i figured it could work for a code review

hmm, i should point out that i'm an idiot for not pulling out the shared code from each method into its own method, but what i'm really trying to get at is that i don't want to have to respond to each event individually at all, moreso reduce everything below line 231 into two short methods
